Package org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.certextensions

Interface CustomCertificateExtension

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CustomCVCertificateExtension
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicCertificateExtension
    public interface CustomCertificateExtension
    Interface for custom certificate extensions.
    Version:
    $Id: CustomCertificateExtension.java 29941 2018-10-01 14:44:59Z henriks $

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        int getId()
        Returns:
        the unique id of the extension

      • getOID

        String getOID()
        Returns:
        The unique OID of the extension

      • getAvailableProperties

        Map<String,​String[]> getAvailableProperties()
        Returns:
        a map containing available extension properties as keys, along with possible values.

      • getDisplayName

        String getDisplayName()
        Returns:
        This extension's readable name

      • isCriticalFlag

        boolean isCriticalFlag()
        Returns:
        flag indicating if the extension should be marked as critical or not.

      • isRequiredFlag

        boolean isRequiredFlag()
        Returns:
        flag indicating if the extension should be marked as required or not.

      • getProperties

        Properties getProperties()
        The propertes configured for this extension. The properties are stripped of the beginning "idX.property.". So searching for the property "id1.property.value" only the key "value" should be used in the returned property.
        Returns:
        the properties configured for this certificate extension.

      • getValueEncoded

        byte[] getValueEncoded​(EndEntityInformation userData,
                       CA ca,
                       CertificateProfile certProfile,
                       PublicKey userPublicKey,
                       PublicKey caPublicKey,
                       CertificateValidity val)
                throws CertificateExtensionException
        Method that should return the byte[] value used in the extension. The default implementation of this method first calls the getValue() method and then encodes the result as an byte array. CertificateExtension implementors has the choice of overriding this method if they want to include byte[] data in the certificate that is not necessarily an ASN.1 structure otherwise the getValue method can be implemented as before.
        Parameters:
        userData - the userdata of the issued certificate.
        ca - the CA data with access to all the keys etc
        certProfile - the certificate profile
        userPublicKey - public key of the user, or null if not available
        caPublicKey - public key of the CA, or null if not available
        val - validity of certificate where the extension will be added
        Returns:
        a byte[] or null, if this extension should not be used, which was determined from the values somehow.
        Throws:
        CertificateExtensionException - if there was an error constructing the certificate extensio

      • getValueEncoded

        byte[] getValueEncoded​(EndEntityInformation userData,
                       CA ca,
                       CertificateProfile certProfile,
                       PublicKey userPublicKey,
                       PublicKey caPublicKey,
                       CertificateValidity val,
                       String oid)
                throws CertificateExtensionException
        Method that should return the byte[] value used in the extension. The default implementation of this method first calls the getValue() method and then encodes the result as an byte array. CertificateExtension implementors has the choice of overriding this method if they want to include byte[] data in the certificate that is not necessarily an ASN.1 structure otherwise the getValue method can be implemented as before.
        Parameters:
        userData - the userdata of the issued certificate.
        ca - the CA data with access to all the keys etc
        certProfile - the certificate profile
        userPublicKey - public key of the user, or null if not available
        caPublicKey - public key of the CA, or null if not available
        val - validity of certificate where the extension will be added
        oid - OID used to fetch extension data value from the request, in case of dynamic extension.
        Returns:
        a byte[] or null, if this extension should not be used, which was determined from the values somehow.
        Throws:
        CertificateExtensionException - if there was an error constructing the certificate extension.
